My First Public Prayer 

     I returned home, and again went before the Lord, promising to do and suffer anything He might require of me, if only the smiles of Jesus might cheer my heart. The same duty was again presented to me that had troubled my mind before,--to take up my cross among the assembled people of God. An 
                                                                           38
opportunity was not long wanting; there was a prayer meeting that evening at my uncle's, which I attended.
